resource.name: MR COVID-19 SCREENING RATE
resource.title: Screening Rate
resource.description: Percentage of patients with a face-to-face, telehealth, telephone, or admission encounter for whom a COVID-19 communicable disease screening was performed.

population.description: Patients for whom a COVID-19 communicable disease screening was performed.
Patients with a face-to-face, telehealth, telephone, or admission encounter.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 PRESUMPTIVE POSITIVE COUNT
resource.title: Total Presumptive Positive Count
resource.description: The total number of patients for whom a presumptive positive result for a COVID-19 test was documented.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 PRESUMPTIVE POSITIVE COUNT (0-3 YEARS OLD)
resource.title: Total Presumptive Positive Count (0-3 YEARS OLD)
resource.description: The total number of patients for whom a presumptive positive result for a COVID-19 test was documented. Only patients three years old or younger will be evaluated.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 PRESUMPTIVE POSITIVE COUNT (4-18 YEARS OLD)
resource.title: Total Presumptive Positive Count (4-18 YEARS OLD)
resource.description: The total number of patients for whom a presumptive positive result for a COVID-19 test was documented. Only patients 4 to 18 years old will be evaluated.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 PRESUMPTIVE POSITIVE COUNT (19-44 YEARS OLD)
resource.title: Total Presumptive Positive Count (19-44 YEARS OLD)
resource.description: The total number of patients for whom a presumptive positive result to a test for COVID-19 was documented. Only patients 19 to 44 years old will be evaluated.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 PRESUMPTIVE POSITIVE COUNT (45-54 YEARS OLD)
resource.title: Total Presumptive Positive Count (45-54 YEARS OLD)
resource.description: The total number of patients for whom a presumptive positive result for a COVID-19 test was documented.  Only patients 45 to 54 years old will be evaluated.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 PRESUMPTIVE POSITIVE COUNT (55-64 YEARS OLD)
resource.title: Total Presumptive Positive Count (55-64 YEARS OLD)
resource.description: The total number of patients for whom a presumptive positive result for a COVID-19 test was documented.  Only patients 55 to 64 years old will be evaluated.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 PRESUMPTIVE POSITIVE COUNT (65-74 YEARS OLD)
resource.title: Total Presumptive Positive Count (65-74 YEARS OLD)
resource.description: The total number of patients for whom a presumptive positive result for a COVID-19 test was documented.  Only patients 65 to 74 years old will be evaluated.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 PRESUMPTIVE POSITIVE COUNT (75-84 YEARS OLD)
resource.title: Total Presumptive Positive Count (75-84 YEARS OLD)
resource.description: The total number of patients for whom a presumptive positive result for a COVID-19 test was documented. Only patients 75 to 84 years old will be evaluated.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 PRESUMPTIVE POSITIVE COUNT (85+ YEARS OLD)
resource.title: Total Presumptive Positive Count (85+ YEARS OLD)
resource.description: The total number of patients for whom a presumptive positive result for a COVID-19 test was documented. Only patients 85 years old or older will be evaluated.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 TOTAL TESTS
resource.title: Total Tests
resource.description: The number of patients for whom a test for COVID-19 was ordered.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 PENDING TESTS
resource.title: Pending Tests
resource.description: The number of patients for whom a test for COVID-19 has been ordered, but for whom a final result has not been documented.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 ENCOUNTERS WITH A PRESUMPTIVE POSITIVE TEST
resource.title: Presumptive Positive Percentage
resource.description: The percentage of face-to-face, telehealth, telephone, or admission encounters for which a presumptive positive COVID-19 case is identified. The results for this metric are not stratified by age. This metric helps to identify what percentage of resources are going towards treating COVID-19 patients.

population.description:
Patients with a COVID-19 screening which is presumptive positive.
Note: It is not necessary for the visit to be in the denominator to be in the numerator, but it is necessary that they be in the age stratification.
Face-to-face, telehealth, telephone, or admission encounters with a patient.

resource.name: MR COVID-19 ENCOUNTERS WITH A PRESUMPTIVE POSITIVE TEST (0-3 YEARS OLD)
resource.title: Presumptive Positive Percentage (0-3 Years Old)
resource.description: The percentage of face-to-face, telehealth, telephone, or admission encounters for which a presumptive positive COVID-19 case is identified. Only patients three years old or younger will be evaluated. This metric helps to identify what percentage of resources are going towards treating COVID-19 patients.

population.description:
